para: EllipseElementSelect is a selection method that selects &elems; in response to a mouse click in the graphics window when the Skeleton Selection toolbox is active and is set to Element mode. It selects all &elems; lying within a ellipse swept out by dragging the mouse, as shown in . The ellipse is defined by the rectangle that bounds it. Click the mouse on one corner of the rectangle and drag to the diagonally opposite corner.
skeleton is the &skel; from which the &elems; are to be selected.

points is a of objects. The first point in the list is one corner of the rectangle bounding the ellipse, and the second point is the diagonally opposite corner. Any other points in the list will be ignored.

The shift and ctrl parameters govern how the current selection (i.e, the set of &elems; defined by this operation) is merged with the previous selection (the &elems; already selected) to form a new selection, as shown in . They indicate whether (1) or not (0) the shift and control keys were depressed during the mouse click that initiated this command.
